newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Lloyds Bank's Brazil unit to launch offshore fund.
newsitem.headline: Lloyds Bank's Brazil unit to launch offshore fund.

text.p: The Brazilian unit of Lloyds Bank Plc said it plans to launch its first offshore fund on October 14 and hopes to raise at least $100 million in the first year.

Lloyds Bank Brasil said in a statement that Lloyds Brazil Asset Management SICAV will be based in Luxembourg and cater to international investors, fund managers, individuals and foreign firms interested in investing in Brazil.
The "umbrella" fund actually will be comprised of two funds: the Brazil International Fixed Income Fund and the Brazil Equity Fund, the bank said.
Brazil International Fixed Income Fund will invest in Eurobonds issued by Brazilian companies "which offer an adequate level of liquidity with low risk."
Brazil Equity Fund will invest in shares of Brazilian firms traded on local and foreign stock exchanges and included in the Sao Paulo Stock Exchange's Bovespa index .BVSP.
The "umbrella" fund will be managed by Lloyds Bank in Luxembourg, with Lloyds in Brazil as its investment adviser.
The bank said it was considering launching other offshore funds.
